question: Can I afford a mortgage on a $300,000 home with a $70,000 annual income and a credit score of 720?
true_answer: Yes, with a credit score of 720 and a calculated DTI of 28%, you can afford a mortgage on a $300,000 home. A down payment of 10-20% is typical.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage on a $300,000 home with a $70,000 annual income and a credit score of 720?
Plan: 1) Check credit score with credit_agent. 2) Calculate affordability with home_loan_agent. 3) Confirm with supervisor_agent.
Credit score 720 is excellent, above the typical requirement.
A typical rule of thumb is that total monthly mortgage payments should not exceed 28% of your gross monthly income.
Calculating monthly gross income and potential mortgage payment.
Your gross monthly income is approximately $5,833, suggesting a max mortgage payment of about $1,633 per month.
What would be the typical down payment for this mortgage?
Retrieving knowledge on down payment requirements.
A typical down payment ranges from 10-20% of the home value.
Final review to ensure all information is consistent.
Review complete. All criteria and calculations check out.
Yes, with a credit score of 720 and a calculated DTI of 28%, you can afford a mortgage on a $300,000 home. A down payment of 10-20% is typical.
